page.title: 03LOCAL COUNCILLOR
page.content: A Councillor for Manchester City Council came into school to be interviewed. She came to Didsbury in 1947 and liked it so much she stayed .We asked her in what ways she would wish to see the area improved. She expressed concern at the slovenly attitudes of people today - for example in their treatment of the environment.She felt that vandalism had incresed and should be dealt with severely, for example by on the spot fines.She told us that local councillors are not paid for their work which often involves them in a great deal of hard work.
